org.davidmoten.text.utils

Class WordWrap.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.davidmoten.text.utils.WordWrap.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    WordWrap

    public static final class WordWrap.Builder
extends Object
    Provides method chaining for specifying parameters to word wrap.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      WordWrap.Builder breakWords(boolean breakWords)
      If a word is longer than maxWidth and breakWords is true then such a word will be broken across two or more lines (with or without a hyphen according to insertHyphens(boolean)).
      WordWrap.Builder excludeExtraWordChars(String excludeWordChars)
      Adds extra word characters to be excluded.
      WordWrap.Builder extraWordChars(Set<Character> extraWordChars)
      Sets all extra word characters (characters that will be treated like normal alphabetic characters for defining word boundaries).

      Sets all extra word characters (characters that will be treated like normal alphabetic characters for defining word boundaries).

      Adds more word characters (characters that will be treated like normal alphabetic characters for defining word boundaries).
      WordWrap.Builder insertHyphens(boolean insertHyphens)
      Sets if to break words using a hyphen character.

      Sets the maximum width of a line using the stringWidth function.
      WordWrap.Builder newLine(String newLine)
      Sets the newLine string to be used.
      WordWrap.Builder stringWidth(Function<? super CharSequence,? extends Number> stringWidth)
      Sets the string width function used to determine if a line is at maximum width (and therefore needing wrapping or splitting).

      Performs the wrapping of the source text and returns output as a String.

    • Method Detail

      • maxWidth

        public WordWrap.Builder maxWidth(Number maxWidth)
        Sets the maximum width of a line using the stringWidth function. Word wrapping/splitting will be attempted for lines with greater than maxWidth. If not set the default is 80.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - maximum width of a line using the stringWidth function.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if maxWidth is less than or equal to zero

      • stringWidth

        public WordWrap.Builder stringWidth(Function<? super CharSequence,? extends Number> stringWidth)
        Sets the string width function used to determine if a line is at maximum width (and therefore needing wrapping or splitting). If not set the string width function is the number of characters.
        Parameters:
        stringWidth - function that returns the width of a sequence of characters
        Returns:
        this

      • newLine

        public WordWrap.Builder newLine(String newLine)
        Sets the newLine string to be used. If not set the default is '\n' (line feed character).
        Parameters:
        newLine - string to be output on for a new line delimiter
        Returns:
        this

      • extraWordChars

        public WordWrap.Builder extraWordChars(Set<Character> extraWordChars)
        Sets all extra word characters (characters that will be treated like normal alphabetic characters for defining word boundaries).
        Parameters:
        extraWordChars - extra word characters (in addtion to alphabetic characters)
        Returns:
        this

      • extraWordChars

        public WordWrap.Builder extraWordChars(String extraWordChars)
        Sets all extra word characters (characters that will be treated like normal alphabetic characters for defining word boundaries).
        Parameters:
        extraWordChars - extra word characters (in addtion to alphabetic characters)
        Returns:

      • includeExtraWordChars

        public WordWrap.Builder includeExtraWordChars(String includeWordChars)
        Adds more word characters (characters that will be treated like normal alphabetic characters for defining word boundaries).
        Parameters:
        includeWordChars - more word characters
        Returns:
        this

      • excludeExtraWordChars

        public WordWrap.Builder excludeExtraWordChars(String excludeWordChars)
        Adds extra word characters to be excluded. Alphabetic characters are always word characters and thus will be ignored here.
        Parameters:
        excludeWordChars - extra word characters to be excluded
        Returns:
        this

      • insertHyphens

        public WordWrap.Builder insertHyphens(boolean insertHyphens)
        Sets if to break words using a hyphen character. If set to false then no breaking character will be used.
        Parameters:
        insertHyphens - whether to break hyphens
        Returns:
        this

      • breakWords

        public WordWrap.Builder breakWords(boolean breakWords)
        If a word is longer than maxWidth and breakWords is true then such a word will be broken across two or more lines (with or without a hyphen according to insertHyphens(boolean)).
        Parameters:
        breakWords - if true then break words across lines
        Returns:
        this

      • wrap

        public void wrap(Writer out)
        Performs the wrapping of the source text and writes output to the given Writer.
        Parameters:
        out - output for wrapped text

      • wrap

        public void wrap(File file,
                 Charset charset)
        Performs the wrapping of the source text and writes output to the given file with the given character set encoding.
        Parameters:
        file - file to receive wrapped output
        charset - encoding to use for output

      • wrapUtf8

        public void wrapUtf8(File file)

        Parameters:
        file - output file for wrapped text
